lexUnit.name: ample.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: enough or more than enough; plentiful.

sentence.text: Surprisingly , no power is conferred for this purpose , either by statute or by the common law , although there was ample authority to enter to arrest if there were sufficient grounds to suspect that an offence had been committed .
Lord Hailsham held that the mental element required for rape was intent and that there was ample authority in support of this proposition .
With ample historical evidence on their side , the expansionists replied that visibility was a tested means of swelling research budgets .
And in a lifetime spent covering the major developments and events in Northern Ireland , he has had ample evidence of the truth of that remark .
There was ample space in the Hall for all the prizemen 's work to have been shown .
In certain species , the long , fine roots trail below as far as the muddy or sandy bottom and anchor the plant , still giving it ample freedom for floating .
It 's been designed to act as a snug environment for babies up to six months and there are ample pockets for nappies , easy heats and favourite toys .
Written exercises have ample space for answers to be clearly written in .
A row about 100 cm ( 3 ft ) long is ample for one family 's needs for most herbs .
Its behaviour thus offers the subject ample opportunity to assess and accept the amiability of the approach .
We are the only dinner guests this Friday evening , so the bespectacled Mr Moore has ample opportunity to demonstrate his wide-ranging talents .
If you did , you saw one main film and had ample opportunity to buy ice cream .
Ample car parking is available .
Ample parking space is available in front of Llanthony Warehouse .
Lord Justice Waller said he was ` quite satisfied that the Judge had ample grounds to make him sure that the appellants had been telling lies " .
When you are involved with other people ( divorce or traffic accidents , for example ) take ample time beforehand to think over your version of events and to write everything down .
Actually , the Governor would have ample reason to feel paranoid if he did but know the gist of the message Jaq intended to send .
Candidates will be assigned an office role within a scenario and provided with ample data on which to base an adequate answer .
If you have n't read it you will have ample chance to read it at a later date and if you have , you would know what I was going to say .
The train was due to arrive at her destination at midday -- which gave Fabia , free of any other occupation , ample time to go over and over again everything that had happened .
The British Medical Association , well they 'll have ample ammunition now to say that boxing is no longer a sport .
Horses need ample fresh water , which means keeping water troughs clean an filled ; and making sure that ground water , such as in dams or streams , does not become polluted .
Sensuality , fun and an ample dose of raunchy dance brought the whole programme alive .
Even if the security is ample , the bank will not want the time , trouble and loss of goodwill involved in attempting to repossess its loan .
His leisure time , which was ample , was spent mainly in aesthetic contemplation of the moral and social degeneration of which he considered himself a part , if apart .
GUITARIST , ambitious , professional with ample live and studio experience , seeks band with recording deal and/or tour .
